Class codegen.CodeGen 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----codegen.CodeGen
public class CodeGen
extends Object
This class provides a simple interface to other parts of pest. path is a path name to a directory, where CodeGen will store its files. We expect path to be a valid path name, that is, it is a directory, indeed, and the directory is writable. Statechart is a syntactically correct and valid statechart. If an error occures, we will throw a CodeGenException.

Version:
$Id: CodeGen.java,v 1.4 1998/12/15 17:51:42 swtech00 Exp $
Author:
Marcel Kyas, Walter Loeser, Andre Paetzold.

CodeGen(String, Statechart)
This method will cause the CodeGenerator to do its work.
CodeGen(String, Statechart, int)
This method will cause the CodeGenerator to do its work.

Generate(String, Statechart)
This method is an alternative to produce code, if you do not want to create a new instance of the code generator.
Generate(String, Statechart, int)
This method is an alternative to produce code, if you do not want to create a new instance of the code generator.

CodeGen 
 public CodeGen(String path,
                Statechart statechart) throws CodeGenException
This method will cause the CodeGenerator to do its work. If will return after successful completion.

CodeGen 
 public CodeGen(String path,
                Statechart statechart,
                int options) throws CodeGenException
This method will cause the CodeGenerator to do its work. If will return after successful completion. This will activate some options.

Generate 
 public void Generate(String path,
                      Statechart statechart) throws CodeGenException
This method is an alternative to produce code, if you do not want to create a new instance of the code generator.

Generate 
 public void Generate(String path,
                      Statechart statechart,
                      int options) throws CodeGenException
This method is an alternative to produce code, if you do not want to create a new instance of the code generator. This time with options.
